Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods enable you to add and remove individual controls from the collection. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.AddRange%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Clear%2A> methods to add or remove all the controls from the collection.
You can determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> is a member of the collection by passing the control into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Contains%2A> method. To get the index value of the location of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> in the collection, pass the control into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method. The collection can be copied into an array by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.CopyTo%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this overload of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.AddRange%2A> to merge one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection> with another. You typically use this method with <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripOverflow>, and you can easily use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Insert%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Remove%2A> methods to modify the merged <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection>.
Use the overload of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.AddRange%2A> that takes a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> array to copy an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> controls to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection>.

abstract member Clear : unit -> unit override this.Clear : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Removes all items from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove the entire collection of controls from a parent control.
To remove an individual control from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> controls to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method to ensure that all the controls are removed from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection>, all subsequent controls are moved up one position in the collection.
You can also remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method, or remove all controls by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Clear%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.
